meanings.definition: Unable to be expressed in words.
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the sunset was truly unsayables.
meanings.sent2: Her emotions were so complex that they felt unsayables.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to meow silently was quite unsayables.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak was shrouded in mist, creating an unsayables aura.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the exotic fruit was a burst of unsayables flavors.

meanings.definition: Things that cannot be said or spoken.
meanings.sent1: In the library, there were shelves filled with unsayables.
meanings.sent2: The box contained a collection of unsayables from different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The secret society had a vault where they kept their unsayables.
meanings.sent4: The artist's studio was a treasure trove of unsayables waiting to be revealed.
meanings.sent5: The old bookshop held a mysterious section dedicated to unsayables.
